Package me.bristermitten.plumber.scheduling.timings

Interface TaskBuilder

  • public interface TaskBuilder
    Builder for configuring times in the future for scheduling This can be safely injected

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.Class<? extends TaskBuilder> impl
      Default implementation, can be customised to change what Guice uses when creating instances

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      me.bristermitten.plumber.scheduling.Task build()
      Create a new Task from this Builder
      TaskBuilder doing​(java.lang.Runnable r)
      Set the functionality for this Task
      TimeUnitPicker<TaskBuilder> every​(long period)
      Define a repeating period in which the task is executed
      TimeUnitPicker<TaskBuilder> in​(long wait)
      Define an initial delay for the task.

    • Field Detail

      • impl

        static final java.lang.Class<? extends TaskBuilder> impl
        Default implementation, can be customised to change what Guice uses when creating instances

    • Method Detail

      • every

        TimeUnitPicker<TaskBuilder> every​(long period)
        Define a repeating period in which the task is executed
        Parameters:
        period - the period, where the time unit is then picked
        Returns:
        a TimeUnitPicker to pick the time unit

      • in

        TimeUnitPicker<TaskBuilder> in​(long wait)
        Define an initial delay for the task.
        Parameters:
        wait - the wait time, where the time unit is then picked
        Returns:
        a TimeUnitPicker to pick the time unit

      • doing

        TaskBuilder doing​(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Set the functionality for this Task
        Parameters:
        r - the function to run on every execution
        Returns:
        this builder

      • build

        me.bristermitten.plumber.scheduling.Task build()
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Create a new Task from this Builder
        Returns:
        a new Task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if doing(Runnable) has not been called
